oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: American Expeditionary Forces victory poster
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Joseph William Knox received this poster listing major operations and casualties of the AEF during World War I. It includes the text of victory telegrams from President Woodrow Wilson, Gen. John J. Pershing, and Marshal Foch. Knox was a farmer from Dyer County. He served in Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt., in the Meuse-Argonne offensive and was honorably discharged July 31, 1919. Knox was a brick mason and ran a dry cleaners in Dyer, Tennessee. He died on December 20, 1965. [See also GWjack018-023, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:instructionalMethod: US.28; John J. Pershing; World War I
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
